nevi-me commented on pull request #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#discussion_r322030025
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/rust-build-main.bat
 ##########
 @@ -30,6 +30,7 @@ pushd rust
 rustup default nightly
 rustup show
 cargo build --target %TARGET% --all-targets --release || exit /B
+cargo build --target %TARGET% --all-targets --no-default-features --release || exit /B
 
 Review comment:
   Given that in one of the earlier PRs we reduced the amount that this script does (https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/83a4e979271535b74de9870289cf99d02f6eb16b#diff-09e63d5097178234f5b3b9d607d9c88aL47), won't we run the risk of increasing build times too much if we build 2 `--release` binaries here?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

paddyhoran commented on pull request #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#discussion_r322041540
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/rust-build-main.bat
 ##########
 @@ -30,6 +30,7 @@ pushd rust
 rustup default nightly
 rustup show
 cargo build --target %TARGET% --all-targets --release || exit /B
+cargo build --target %TARGET% --all-targets --no-default-features --release || exit /B
 
 Review comment:
   Yea, maybe.  I posted this before the recent issues with build times.  I don't think that this will be used often but we should make sure to test that it at least builds.  I'll change it to a debug build.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

paddyhoran commented on issue #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#issuecomment-529284581
 
 
   @hengruo @nevi-me I think I need to revert [ARROW-6408](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303).  We need the SIMD code to stripped out early in the process so that it does not cause a `use of undeclared type or module` error.

   @hengruo @nevi-me I think I need to revert [ARROW-6408](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303).  We need the SIMD code to stripped out early in the process so that it does not cause a `use of undeclared type or module` error.

paddyhoran commented on issue #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#issuecomment-529743025
 
 
   @hengruo @nevi-me it seems that I will need to revert [ARROW-6408](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303).
   
   Although it would eventually be removed, using `if cfg!(...)` leaves the SIMD code in place for the first pass of the compiler leading to `use of undeclared type or module` error. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

   > 
   > Although it would eventually be removed, using `if cfg!(...)` leaves the SIMD code in place for the first pass of the compiler leading to `use of undeclared type or module` error.
   
   Sorry, only seeing this now. Do we still need to revert?

paddyhoran commented on issue #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#issuecomment-529909620
 
 
   >Do we still need to revert?
   
   I think so yes, but I am having an issue with CI as well.  I don't think that travis is triggering the `--no-default-features` build, it seems that [this](https://github.com/paddyhoran/arrow/blob/simd-feature/ci/travis_script_rust.sh#L35) line is not executed.  In the logs you can see that it only compiles once before running the tests, I was expecting it to compile twice.  
   
   I was hoping to look at the AppVeyor logs (I'm more familiar with windows) after the most recent commit but it failed before running the Rust build.
   
   I can't build locally as it is now, but I reverted the changes last night and I can build it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

paddyhoran commented on issue #5269: ARROW-6303: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5269#issuecomment-532484538
 
 
   This was confusing me no end as I could not build locally without reverting [6408](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303).  I found that the `--no-default-features` flag is [not](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/5015) passed from the workspace to the sub-crates.  I'm going to update CI to prove it out and then fix it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
We should allow building without SIMD behind a feature flag.  SIMD has caused issues for some people, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5613

I could not re-produce this but it would be good to provide a solution to users like this.

Also, this would inch us closer to building on stable again.
fields.summary: [Rust] Add a feature to disable SIMD
